byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

abstract: New York City Police Officer Jose R Ramos is arrested in connection with grand jury investigation into widespread practice of fixing tickets for friends and colleagues, and fifteen others are expected to turn themselves in.
snippet: One officer was arrested Thursday night, and some of the others began to turn themselves in about midnight.
lead_paragraph: One officer was arrested Thursday night, and some of the others began to turn themselves in about midnight.

headline.main: Authorities Move to Charge 16 Officers After Widespread Ticket-Fixing
headline.print_headline: Authorities Move to Charge 16 Officers After Widespread Ticket-Fixing
headline.seo: In Ticket-Fixing Scandal, 16 Officers to Be Charged
